summary: This document is an email chain from November 10, 2020, forwarding a letter from a law firm concerning a potential victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The correspondence involves U.S. Attorney's Office personnel and attorney Jennifer Freeman, discussing the referral of the victim's information to the FBI for investigation.

persons.name: Jennifer Freeman
persons.role: Attorney at Marsh Law Firm PLLC
persons.context: She is the sender of the original letter concerning a potential Epstein/Maxwell victim, which is being forwarded within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Forwarding of Victim Letter
events.description: An email chain forwards a letter from attorney Jennifer Freeman concerning a potential victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS). The letter is referred for potential investigation.

keyFacts: A letter from attorney Jennifer Freeman of Marsh Law Firm PLLC identifies a potential victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The letter was forwarded to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) on November 10, 2020.
The correspondence indicates the victim's counsel had previously advised she was not in a position to be interviewed a year prior, but the matter was still referred to the FBI.
The email chain shows internal protocol for handling potential victim information related to the charged Epstein/Maxwell case.
